Message.Title: Airbus in Talks to Sell More A320 Neo Models in China
Message.Msg: in discussions to sell several hundred more A320neos in China after securing commitments for the re-engined version of the single-aisle jet. The planemaker is in an active sales campaign for A320neos as the jet is popular among Chinese customers, Robin Tao, a Beijing-based spokesman for Airbus, said by phone today. Airbus secured order commitments for 100 neos from China, subject to government approval, he said. The planemaker won commitments for 20 planes from Industrial & Commercial Bank of China Ltd.’s leasing arm, a deal that was announced last year. Sixty are from Air China Ltd. (601111), out of the 100 A320s it announced in May. The remaining 20 were from a customer Tao didn’t identify because of a confidentiality agreement.

I'm not a fan of individual stocks. I much prefer mutual funds and other more diversified investment vehicles. I do own some Boeing stock, but that was given to me by the company and I've just decided to hang on to it rather than sell it. So whether it's Airbus, Boeing, Tesla or whoever's stock and what it's currently trading at, I could care less. It doesn't affect me. How's that Boeing job working for me? Exceptionally well, thank you very much. I'm not even old enough to retire, but I have done so well money-wise at Boeing that I already have way more money than I need for retirement. Standards ... Topic.Title: Imagine, a Christian who lives like... well, Jesus

Message.Msg: Tech, I never cursed my parents, but that means nothing. I guarantee you that I am guilty of "violating" other laws of Moses. A misconception regarding the laws of Moses is applicability to a believer in Jesus. The Apostle Paul spent a great deal of time trying to explain to the new believers that they were no longer "under the law", but "under grace". The law and blood sacrifices no longer were used for "justification" (salvation) because Jesus fulfilled (completed and made unecessary the requirement to be obedient to) the law. Does that mean that the Christian is allowed to go out and sin "like the devil"? No. The obedient Christian is supposed to flee from sin and be obedient to God's Word - as a matter of desire, not out of fear of punishment. The laws of Moses, save for rituals associated with defining the Jews "separate" life and faith (e.g., "shellfish" and "circumcision"), are useful as guidelines for an obedient Christian life. What is in the Ten Commandments (Exodus 20) and the death penalty prescription for murder (Gen 9:6) are NOT laws of Moses; they are directly from God. But obedience to those still does not define salvation - only faith in Christ. (John 14:6, Ephesians 2:8,9) BB

Topic.Title: Imagine, a Christian who lives like... well, Jesus

Message.Msg: "Maybe he needs some forgiveness in his life?" Tech, A cogent thought. As we are all like sheep who have gone astray. There is a time and place and manner to lay out the matter-of-fact truths of the Bible regarding sin. Mostly from the pulpit or general Bible discussions and studies. However, both the Old Testament and New Testament warn the believer to warn others of sin - or "blood will be on their hands". Yet, Jesus emphasized not being judgmental, hypocritical, and the oft-stated "holier than thou". A quandary? He told his disciples to shake the dust off their feet and leave those that reject their message (of salvation through Jesus). One challenge with sharing the love of God is explaining why it is important and how it is manifested. It is difficult, if not impossible, to discuss God's love without pointing out that it is obtained through belief in Jesus who died for our sins. And, thus, the "sin" issue is unavoidable and it is also appropriate to be discussed. Unless a person sees him or herself as a "sinner", the logical question would be, "so why do I have to believe?" The consequences of disbelief are explicit in the Bible and have to be explained. But, the Christian is remiss by thinking that he or she must bear down and press the non-believer into addressing specific sin with the Christian (personally). That I believe is God's job. And the work of the Holy Spirit. It is often sufficient to state that "all have sinned and come short of the Glory of God" (Romans 3:23) - from which most people get the message. BB

Message.Title: Almost a MAJOR OOOOOPSIE in 1961
Message.Msg: or why quadruple redundancy is sometimes worthwhile. Of course losing N carolina might peeve some . . LONDON (AFP) - The US Air Force came dramatically close to detonating a huge atomic bomb over North Carolina in 1961, according to a newly declassified document published by Britain's Guardian newspaper on Saturday.Two hydrogen bombs were accidentally dropped over the city of Goldsboro, North Carolina on January 23, 1961 when the B-52 plane carrying them broke up in mid-air, according to the file.One of the bombs began to detonate -- a single switch was all that stopped it from doing so. The three other safety mechanisms designed to prevent an unintended detonation failed.The US government has acknowledged the accident before, but the 1969 document is the first confirmation of how close the United States came to nuclear catastrophe on that day."It would have been bad news in spades," wrote its author, US government scientist Parker F. Jones.The bomb was 260 times more powerful than the one that devastated Hiroshima in 1945, according to the Guardian.The accident happened at the height of the Cold War between the United States and the Soviet Union.The declassified report was obtained by US investigative journalist Eric Schlosser under freedom of information legislation."The US government has consistently tried to withhold information from the American people in order to prevent questions being asked about our nuclear weapons policy," said Schlosser."We were told there was no possibility of these weapons accidentally detonating, yet here's one that very nearly did."Jones jokingly titled the report "Goldsboro Revisited, or: How I Learned To Mistrust the H-Bomb", a reference to Stanley Kubrick's classic 1964 film about nuclear Armageddon, "Dr Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb".

Message.Msg: Instead Japan nuked themselves with a Fukushima Daiichi nuclear disaster that will eventually contaiminate the entire world. "Planet of the Apes" or a little sterility will end your species. Nuclear power could play a role in reducing global warming emissions because reactors emit almost no carbon while they operate and can have low life-cycle emissions. Partly for that reason, advocates are calling for a nationwide investment in at least 100 new nuclear reactors, backed by greatly expanded (Obama) federal loan guarantees. However, the industry must resolve major economic, safety, security, and waste disposal challenges before new nuclear reactors could make a significant contribution to reducing carbon emissions. We already had an energy presidents so called promise, but all we really got was Bushwacked by a dim bulb in the whitehouse.

Message.Title: 7 in 10 Americans think the Government is for the Big Banks and Big Corporations
Message.Msg: Told ya so ! Zero Hedge Sept. 20, 2013 72% of the poor and 71% of the middle-class believe government policies (fiscal and monetary) have done little or nothing to help them. Of course, this will be eschewed by the academics (as Santelli recently exclaimed regarding the arrogance of the intellectuals) because “the people” just don’t get it. But when 69% of all Americans, according a new Pew study, say large banks and financial institutions have benefited the most from post-recession government policies; communications policies are going badly awry. Despite a surging stock market, exploding home prices, and low rates spurring all kinds of subprime auto loan exuberance, there has been little change in these perceptions since July 2010.

Topic.Title: Colorado Dems who voted for gun control lose recall elections

Message.Msg: I made that remark facetiously because I didn't care for the 'Little Lady' remark.

Topic.Title: The Carzy Party

Message.Msg: And right here--seeing Chemical_Ali_Infested, checkn, badolt, blob, doublehaul, and a host of other crazies--proof that the R party needs to take Bob Dole's advice. "Closed for repairs."
